sentences.en: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 丑闻使这所学校名誉扫地.

sentences.en: He faces six charges of bringing the game into disrepute .
sentences.cn: 他面临六项破坏这项运动声誉的指控。

sentences.en: His association with the gang brought him into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 他同这个帮派的联系使他名誉扫地.
他的理论渐渐名声扫地了.

sentences.en: Many old remedies for illness have fallen into disrepute among doctors.
sentences.cn: 医生们已经不再相信以前使用过的许多药物.

sentences.en: Since the scandal, the school has rather fallen into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 自从发生了这件丑闻, 该校名声大为下降.

sentences.en: Such people bring our profession into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 这种人令我们这一行业蒙羞。

sentences.en: The author's dissenting opinions have brought him into disrepute, especially among his peers.
sentences.cn: 这个作者坚持异议,这使他, 尤其是在他的同辈学者中,声名狼藉.

sentences.en: The hotel fell into disrepute after the shooting incident.
sentences.cn: 枪击事件发生后,这家旅馆便声誉扫地.

sentences.en: The hotel fell into disrepute after they began to serve alcohol.
sentences.cn: 这家旅馆自卖起酒来之后就名声不好.

sentences.en: The official has fallen into disrepute for his embezzlement of the public funds.
sentences.cn: 那名官员因盗用公款而声名狼藉.

sentences.en: The players' behaviour on the field is likely to bring the game into disrepute .
sentences.cn: 球员在赛场上的表现很可能使这场比赛臭名远扬。

sentences.en: The use of drugs is bringing the sport into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 因有人服食禁药,这项运动蒙受了耻辱.

sentences.en: They shall refrain from any act which might bring the profession into disrepute.
sentences.cn: 会员应避免做出任何可能有损本职业声誉的行为.

sentences.en: This company has fallen into disrepute in recent years.
sentences.cn: 这家公司近几年来已是声名狼藉.

sentences.en: This theory fell into disrepute in the fifties.
sentences.cn: 这一理论在50年代时声誉尽失。

words.tran_cn: 声名狼藉的；肮脏的；破烂不堪的

trans.tran_cn: 坏名声，不光彩，声名狼藉
trans.tran_en: a situation in which people no longer admire or trust someone or something
